keyword: calories in a grilled cheese sandwich
title: Calories in a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in a grilled cheese sandwich, including macros like protein and fat, plus tweaks and FAQs for variations.
h1: Calories in a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices American cheese, 1 tbsp butter for grilling; no add-ons like tomato or bacon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard grilled cheese sandwich provides ~350 kcal, with ~15 g protein and ~20 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a basic version with white bread and American cheese.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 15 g, mostly from the cheese.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in a grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Yes—whole wheat may lower carbs and calories slightly compared to white bread.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 20 g total fat, with 10 g saturated from cheese and butter.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Yes—use low-fat cheese, less butter, or whole grain bread to reduce by 50+ kcal.
